Class NeuronFunction

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.LinearCombination
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.LinearCombination
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.NeuronFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
EstimationFunction, ScalarEstimationFunction, TrainableScalarFunction, TrainableFunction
Direct Known Subclasses:
Neuron
@Strategy(CONCRETE) public class NeuronFunction extends LinearCombination
A neuron-like scalar function that combines a LinearCombination with a non-linear ActivationFunction.

The computation is: 

   output = activation( bias + Î£ w_i * x_i )
where the activation function is applied to the linear combination of inputs.

Provides parameter gradient calculations that include the effect of the activation function, making this class suitable for use in neural network training via backpropagation.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    NeuronFunction(float[] parameters, ActivationFunction activationFunction)
    Creates a new neuron function with the given parameters and activation.

  • Constructor Details

    • NeuronFunction

      public NeuronFunction(float[] parameters, ActivationFunction activationFunction)
      Creates a new neuron function with the given parameters and activation.

      The parameter array follows the LinearCombination convention: index 0 is the bias, indices 1.. are the weights.

      Parameters:
      parameters - parameter vector (bias + weights)
      activationFunction - the non-linear activation function to apply

  • Method Details

    • getActivationFunction

      public ActivationFunction getActivationFunction()
      Returns the activation function applied to the weighted sum.
      Returns:
      the activation function

    • estimateScalar

      public float estimateScalar(float[] inputs)
      Estimates the scalar output by first computing the weighted sum (via LinearCombination.estimateScalar(float[])) and then applying the activation function.
      Specified by:
      estimateScalar in interface ScalarEstimationFunction
      Overrides:
      estimateScalar in class LinearCombination
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector
      Returns:
      the activated scalar output
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs.length != arity()

    • calculateParameterGradients

      public float[] calculateParameterGradients(float[] inputs)
      Calculates the gradients of the output with respect to all parameters, including the effect of the activation function.

      Concretely:

      • First calls calculateParameterGradients_df_dp(float[]) to compute gradients of the pre-activation linear function (bias + weighted inputs).
      • Then multiplies each gradient by the derivative of the activation function evaluated at the current output.
      Specified by:
      calculateParameterGradients in interface TrainableScalarFunction
      Overrides:
      calculateParameterGradients in class LinearCombination
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector
      Returns:
      the gradient vector (bias gradient followed by weight gradients)

    • calculateParameterGradients_df_dp

      public float[] calculateParameterGradients_df_dp(float[] inputs)
      Calculates the parameter gradients of the underlying linear combination (pre-activation function). This is equivalent to LinearCombination.calculateParameterGradients(float[]).
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector
      Returns:
      the gradient vector of the linear function
